SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.orchestranetworks.ui
Interface UIResponseContext

All Superinterfaces:
UIBodyWriter, UIComponentWriter, UIContext, UIJavaScriptWriter, UIResourceLocator, UISessionContext
public interface UIResponseContext
extends UIContext, UIComponentWriter

Encapsulates a HTTP response so that a bean editor is able to generate its part of the DHTML page, including the building of standard EBX5 components.

See Also:
UIBeanEditor, UI Developer Guide

addUIBestMatchingComponent

public void addUIBestMatchingComponent(Path aPath,
                                       String htmlAttributes)
Adds the user interface component corresponding to the specified field or group, either in 'read-only' or 'read-write' mode. By "best matching", we mean the component will be adapted to the data type and the facets of the node.

This method calls addUIBestMatchingDisplay(Path, String) or addUIBestMatchingEditor(Path, String) according to the rendering mode.

A common use: 

UIResponseContext.addUIBestMatchingComponent(Path.SELF, "")

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component
Since:
5.2.0

addUIBestMatchingDisplay

public void addUIBestMatchingDisplay(Path aPath,
                                     String htmlAttributes)
Adds the user interface component corresponding to the specified field or group, in 'read-only' mode. By "best matching", we mean the component will be adapted to the data type and the facets of the node.

A common use: 

UIResponseContext.addUIBestMatchingDisplay(Path.SELF, "")

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component
Since:
5.2.0

addUIBestMatchingDisplay

public void addUIBestMatchingDisplay(Path aPath,
                                     UIRenderingMode renderingMode,
                                     String htmlAttributes)
Deprecated. The parameter renderingMode was used to distinguish Display and Print mode. Since Print mode is not used anymore, it is recommended to use addUIBestMatchingDisplay(Path, String) instead.

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component

addUIBestMatchingEditor

public void addUIBestMatchingEditor(Path aPath,
                                    String htmlAttributes)
Adds the user interface component corresponding to the specified field or group, in 'read-write' mode. By "best matching", we mean the component will be adapted to the data type and the facets of the node.

The most common use: 

UIResponseContext.addUIBestMatchingEditor(Path.SELF, "")

When using a node which is not in 'read-write' mode, i.e. is 'read-only', addUIBestMatchingDisplay(Path, String) will be called instead.

Note: The use of htmlAttributes argument has a limited support for backward compatibility; it requires extended tests on every browsers that can be used by the end users. More particularly, if the underlying type SchemaNode.getFacetEnumeration() depends on an enumeration, the new combo box will not be used if htmlAttributes is not null or empty; instead the older UIListSearch will be used for backward compatibility.

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for a better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component (see note)

addComboBox

public void addComboBox(Path aPath)
Adds the combo box component for user search and selection in a list.

Regarding the simple HTML drop-down list, this widget facilitates the selection in the list, especially for large enumerations. Another benefit is its low cost for data transfer between the end-user browser and the application server.

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)

newComboBox

public UIComboBox newComboBox(Path aPath)
Returns a new combo box.

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
See Also:
addComboBox(UIComboBox)

addComboBox

public void addComboBox(UIComboBox aWidget)
Adds the specified combo box component for user search and selection in a list.

Regarding the simple HTML drop-down list, this widget facilitates the selection in the list, especially for large enumerations. Another benefit is its low cost for data transfer between the end-user browser and the application server.

Parameters:
aWidget - the combo box to be added.

addUIDropDownBox

public void addUIDropDownBox(Path aPath,
                             String htmlAttributes)
Adds a simple HTML drop-down for user selection in a list.

It is generally recommended to use the more advanced combo box.

The list displayed in the drop-down comes from the enumeration defined by the target node (see SchemaNode.getEnumerationList(ValueContext)).

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component
See Also:
addComboBox(UIComboBox)

addUIDropDownBox

public void addUIDropDownBox(Path aPath,
                             String htmlAttributes,
                             Nomenclature aSpecificNomenclature)
Adds a simple HTML drop-down for user selection in a list.

It is generally recommended to use the more advanced combo box.

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component
aSpecificNomenclature - specifies the "value-label" pairs to use specifically for this component.
See Also:
addComboBox(UIComboBox)

addUIListSearch

public void addUIListSearch(Path aPath,
                            String htmlAttributes)
Deprecated. Since version 5.3.0, a new combo box is available and used as the default in automatically generated forms.

Adds a user input component for search and selection in a list.

The list used for search and selection comes from the enumeration defined by the target node (see SchemaNode.getEnumerationList(ValueContext)).

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component

addUIOccurrenceEditor

public void addUIOccurrenceEditor(Path aPath,
                                  String htmlAttributes)
Deprecated. The default occurrence editor can only work with the default multi-occurrence editor. In the UIBeanEditor.addList(UIResponseContext) method, each occurrence can be added with the best matching display/editor with the indexed path obtained with UIContext.getPathForListOccurrence(int).

The path specified must refer to an indexed element in its last position. For example: .[0]

Parameters:
aPath - required, location of the target, relative to the current node (for better reusability, it is advised to use a relative path)
htmlAttributes - optional, the string is added to the attributes of the main HTML component

addFormRowBestMatchingComponent

public void addFormRowBestMatchingComponent(Path nodePath)
Adds a form row (no icon) containing the best matching component.

This method calls addFormRowBestMatchingDisplay(Path) or addFormRowBestMatchingEditor(Path), depending on the rendering mode.

Parameters:
nodePath - the path of the node to display.
Since:
5.2.0
See Also:
addUIBestMatchingComponent(Path, String)

addFormRowBestMatchingComponent

public void addFormRowBestMatchingComponent(Path nodePath,
                                            boolean enableIcon)
Adds a form row with the best matching component.

This method calls addFormRowBestMatchingDisplay(Path) or addFormRowBestMatchingEditor(Path), depending on the rendering mode.

Parameters:
nodePath - the path of the node to display.
enableIcon - true, include an icon, false, no icon.
Since:
5.2.3
See Also:
addUIBestMatchingComponent(Path, String)

newFormRow

public UIFormRow newFormRow(Path aPath)
Builds the default model-driven form row based on the specified node. Here, "default model-driven" means the icon, label and documentation pane are computed from the data model definition.

Parameters:
aPath - location of the target node, relative to the record root node.
See Also:
UIComponentWriter.newFormRow()

startFormRow

public void startFormRow(Path pathForLabel)
Starts a form row (no icon) containing a label and plain HTML content.

Note: The form row must be ended using UIComponentWriter.endFormRow() after creating its HTML content.

Parameters:
pathForLabel - the path of a node to display its label.
Since:
5.2.0
See Also:
UIComponentWriter.startFormRow(UIFormLabelSpec), addFormRowBestMatchingEditor(Path)

startFormRow

public void startFormRow(Path pathForLabel,
                         boolean enableIcon)
Starts a form row containing an icon, a label, and plain HTML content.

Note: The form row must be ended with UIComponentWriter.endFormRow() after creating its HTML content.

Parameters:
pathForLabel - the path of a node to display its label.
enableIcon - true to enable the icon, false to have no icon.
Since:
5.2.3
See Also:
UIComponentWriter.startFormRow(UIFormLabelSpec), addFormRowBestMatchingEditor(Path)

doEnsureValueIsDefined

public void doEnsureValueIsDefined()
Preinstantiates a value on the current node. This is needed for generating the user interface with adequate default values and structure.

getTableCellStyleHandler

public UITableCellStyleHandler getTableCellStyleHandler()
                                                 throws IllegalStateException
This method allows to customize the look of a table cell.

It can be only invoked in the context of the method UIBeanEditor.addForDisplayInTable(UIResponseContext).

Returns:
the UITableCellStyleHandler to add some styles to the current cell.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this method is called out of a table cell.
Since:
5.2.0

jsBufferAddJavaScriptExpression

public UIResponseContext jsBufferAddJavaScriptExpression(String aJavaScriptExpression)
Deprecated. This method is inactive except if extending UIBeanEditorV4. Use UIJavaScriptWriter.addJS(String) instead.

Adds a JavaScript expression to JavaScript writer.

jsBufferAddString

public UIResponseContext jsBufferAddString(String aString)
Deprecated. Use UIJavaScriptWriter.addJS(String) or UIBodyWriter.add(String) instead.

If extending UIBeanEditorV4, adds a String to JavaScript writer. Otherwise, add a String to the HTTP output stream.

jsBufferEndOfLine

public UIResponseContext jsBufferEndOfLine()
Deprecated. This method is inactive except if extending UIBeanEditorV4. Use UIJavaScriptWriter.addJS_cr() or UIBodyWriter.add_cr() instead.

Adds an end of line when adding content to JavaScript writer.

jsBufferInitalize

public UIResponseContext jsBufferInitalize()
Deprecated. This method is inactive except if extending UIBeanEditorV4.

Initializes a javascript writer.

jsBufferNewLine

public UIResponseContext jsBufferNewLine()
Deprecated. This method is inactive except if extending UIBeanEditorV4. Use UIJavaScriptWriter.addJS_cr() or UIBodyWriter.add_cr() instead.

Continue adding content to JavaScript writer as a new line of JavaScript code

jsBufferReenable

public UIResponseContext jsBufferReenable(boolean isJsBufferWritingModeTemporaryDisabled)
Deprecated. This method is inactive except if extending UIBeanEditorV4.

Ensures JavaScript buffer writing mode must be re-enabled.

The boolean argument must be the result of a previous call to method jsBufferTemporaryDisable().

See Also:
jsBufferTemporaryDisable(), jsBufferNewLine()

jsBufferTemporaryDisable

public boolean jsBufferTemporaryDisable()
Deprecated. This method is inactive except if extending UIBeanEditorV4.

Ensures JavaScript buffer writing mode is temporary disabled.

Returns true if current mode was writing javascript buffer.

See Also:
jsBufferNewLine(), jsBufferReenable(boolean)

getNextHtmlTabIndex

public int getNextHtmlTabIndex()
Deprecated. TabIndexes are no more used in forms, natural order (no tabIndex) is preferred. Currently, the tabindex attribute is used with value -1 to avoid the keyboard having focus (i.e. control buttons of a field)

Returns the next value for HTML tab index in the response.

See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/interact/forms.html#adef-tabindex

addJS_getNodeValue

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_getNodeValue(Path aPath)
Adds JavaScript code to get the current value of a node as set in the form.

Parameters:
aPath - location of the target node, relative to the record root node.
Since:
5.3.1
See Also:
UIFormPaneWriter.addJS_getNodeValue(Path)

addJS_setNodeValue

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_setNodeValue(String aVarName,
                                             Path aPath)
Adds JavaScript code to set the value of a node from a JavaScript variable.

Parameters:
aVarName - the name of a JavaScript variable containing the value, or the raw value.
aPath - location of the target node, relative to the record root node.
Since:
5.3.1
See Also:
UIFormPaneWriter.addJS_setNodeValue(String, Path)
